conclusion: Optical fiber is the main carrier of signal propagation in optical fiber communication.
A laser beam is injected into a straight optical fiber from point O at an incident angle of 45°, and total reflection occurs on the side of the optical fiber.
The problem requires determining the angle of reflection θ within the optical fiber.
The image depicts an optical fiber with a laser beam entering at point O. The angle of incidence α is 45°.
The beam is injected into the optical fiber at an angle α = 45°.
According to the law of reflection, the angle of incidence α is equal to the angle of reflection θ.
The total internal reflection at the fiber's inner surface implies that α is the critical angle, and θ is equal to α.
